timeline.message:
replaced lambda with private method

lambda expression was too long, placing it in a seperate method makes it more readable

Replaced anonymous method with private method

anonymous method was too long, making the method, however small, unreadable. Also suppressed a small duplicate code.

Solved static base member being accessed from derived class

In 5 files where SYNCHRONIZATION_ALWAYS from AbstractPlatformTransactionManager was used, but was called from it's derived class JpaTransactionManager.

Suppressed return null issues

In the file there were 2 instances of returning null rather than an empty list. The reason for this was that the object(s) used to fill the list couldn't be made, making an empty list misleading

fixed argument not being used

The last argument in the string builder was not being used. This was because the brackets for the third argument were missing. Added brackets to solve the issue.

unused assignment removed

removed an unused assignment. listOfObvjectArrays is not used after being set to null, making it never used. Also the initial setting is from a query making it useless to empty it

suppressed several null returns

reason for suppressing is given at each specific point, but generally there is no list that should be returned, regardless of the amount of elements, making null the most logical return value

Fixed several SonarQube issues

One main issue was with errors being thrown within a catch, and then being catched again and send to a method. I changed it so the first catch calls the method with the new exception. This is also explained in a comment in DeviceManagerEndpoint. Due to the amount of occurences I felt that I needed to explain what I did and why in case there is a good reason for doing it the way it was done

More SonarQube fixes

Most fixes are simple and / documented. In ValidationException the set is simplified, as the old declaration was unnecessarily complicated

revert a change

apperantly the previous way of solving the SonarQube issue caused other issues at build, therefor the change is reverted and suppressed

timeline.bodyText:
This changes the exception thrown from a FunctionalException into a TechnicalException with less information on what is the error.
To prevent such a situation, first write a test, then refactor. If the test fails, you know you broke something.
Revert the changes.
timeline.author: robindenadel

timeline.bodyText: Changes are fine. To prove no functionality has changed, write a unit test

timeline.message:
Update CommunicationMonitoringConfig.java

Improved description of suppress warnings, and reverted and suppressed an issue with autowiring a parameter

Reverted change

Reverted changes there where an exception throw was replaced with calling a method with this exception. This code unneccesarely complicated the code since the handleException is being called on it later on nonetheless. I suppressed the issue about logging an exception and then rethrowing it.
Added a small test to check that the change in DeviceManagementService doesn't break functionality.
Removed SuppressWarnings, appearently there is no issue.
Several changes based on the feedback provided to earlier changes.

Changed AbstractPushSetup and AbstractPushSetupConverter to allow returning an empty list rather then null

The code in AbstractPushConverter is tested to make sure that the changes don't change the behavior.

Removed issue suppression in SpecificAttributeValueRequest.

After tests it turned out that there was no issue with the function. After removing the suppression and running SonarLint it seems as though it doesn't give an issue anymore.

Fix comments on issues in ClockStatus and ClockStatusBit.

There were 2 issues for which changes were requested. The first one is suppressing the issue of returning null in ClockStatus. The method where this issue is suppressed, is never called and therefor it was changed to return an empty set.

The other issue was returning null in ClockStatusBit. Here we looked at ways to fix it, but kept running into the problem that the code was written with the idea that certain values could / should be null. In the end we decided to neither change nor suppress the issue, since someone with more knowledge about the specific code should look at it instead.

Made 2 small changes to fix issues.

Removed some commented code in AbstractPushSetupConverter and added an explanation to the suppressing in SmartMeteringManagementEndpoint.
Merge branch 'development' into code_quality/Solving_SonarQube_Issues

Some small changes regarding tests

Remove an unused dependency in ws-admin, remove a test that was made for trying something and removed the public from another test

New fixes to the sonar issue of logging and throwing errors

A new fix to the sonar issues of logging an error and then rethowring it. I removed the suppressing and the logging, since the exception should be logged where it will be handled.

Some small changes made to sonar issues and a test

Remove 2 warning suppressings and change junit assertion to assertj in test

Add tests to the DeviceManagementServiceTest

These tests are intended for checking the behavior of the
handleDescription in DeviceManagementService. A small change was made
here that shouldn't change behavior and these tests should confirm this.

Remove suppression for some String issues

Remove the suppression of certain issues where the String wasn't build
properly. There is no issue for in on the current SonarQube server,
indicating that it is no longer seen as an issue
Remove public from ClockStatusTest
Change size != 0 to isEmpty in AbstractPushSetupConverter

Remove the suppression of generic wildcard warning

While there is no immediate reason to change the code as this might impact behavior, it is not necessarily a false positive. SonarQube advises against using it and this advise could be followed here.

Removed suppression of LOGGER name issue

This doesn't count as a false positive. It therefor shouldn't be suppressed.
Merge branch 'development' into code_quality/Solving_SonarQube_Issues
Merge branch 'development' into code_quality/Solving_SonarQube_Issues

Change to return empty list reverted, tests failed

A bigger change in the code is required to fix this SonarQube issue.

Update PushSetupAlarmDtoConverterTest.java

One test was fixed

@@ -10,41 +10,30 @@
 import java.util.EnumSet;
 import java.util.Set;
 
+// suppress warning for duplicate string at reserved (line 21,22,23). The way it
+// is currently done is according to the blue book 12th edition at paragraph 4.1.6.1
+@SuppressWarnings("squid:S1192")
 public enum ClockStatusBit {
 
-    INVALID_VALUE("invalid value"),
-    DOUBTFUL_VALUE("doubtful value"),
+    DAYLIGHT_SAVING_ACTIVE("daylight saving active"),
     DIFFERENT_CLOCK_BASE("different clock base"),
+    DOUBTFUL_VALUE("doubtful value"),
     INVALID_CLOCK_STATUS("invalid clock status"),
+    INVALID_VALUE("invalid value"),
     RESERVED_1("reserved"),
     RESERVED_2("reserved"),
-    RESERVED_3("reserved"),
-    DAYLIGHT_SAVING_ACTIVE("daylight saving active");

some small fixes to several previous changes / additions.

Improved DeviceManagementServiceTest

Improved the tests, mainly by refactoring them to make them more readable. Also added a test for the last possibility
Merge branch 'development' into code_quality/Solving_SonarQube_Issues
Fixed ClockStatusBits
Fixed ValidationException
